description: Cumberland Council says the changes will make bin collections "consistent" across the authority.
title: Allerdale bin collections to be halved despite opposition
title_page: Allerdale bin collections to be halved despite opposition - BBC News
maintext:
A council has announced plans to halve the frequency of general waste collections, despite residents' opposition to the move.
Cumberland Council said black bins will be collected every fortnight instead of once a week in the former Allerdale area from May.
The authority previously launched a consultation on the plans, with 41% of those responding stating they were against the proposals, 31% finding the change acceptable, and the remainder not giving a view.
Councillor Denise Rollo maintained the changes, together with other initiatives implemented to harmonise how waste is collected across the area, would provide a "reliable and efficient" service.
